summary: A light year   is the distance that light travels in empty space in one year.
full_text:
A light-year , sometimes written light year, is a unit of length used informally to express astronomical distances. It is approximately 9 trillion kilometres . As defined by the International Astronomical Union , a light-year is the distance that light travels in vacuum in one Julian year. Because it includes the word year, the term light-year is sometimes misinterpreted as a unit of time.
The light-year is most often used when expressing distances to stars and other distances on a galactic scale, especially in non-specialist and popular science publications. The unit usually used in professional astrometry is the parsec .
title: Light year
